skill.name: finishing-a-development-branch
skill.description: Use when implementation is complete, all tests pass, and you need to decide how to integrate the work - guides completion of development work by presenting structured options for merge, PR, or cleanup
skill.summary: Use when implementation is complete, all tests pass, and you need to decide how to integrate the wor...
skill.author: Cygnusfear

security_audit.summary: This is a documentation-only skill that provides structured guidance for completing git workflows. All 40 static findings are FALSE POSITIVES - the skill contains no executable code, network requests, or file access. The static analyzer misidentified documentation examples as malicious patterns. All detected 'commands' are standard git operations shown as examples in documentation.

content.value_statement: Developers often struggle with the final steps of feature development. This skill provides a clear, structured process for completing branches with proper testing and integration options. It guides you through verifying tests pass, choosing between merge or PR workflows, and safely cleaning up worktrees.
actual_capabilities: Verifies tests pass before presenting completion options
Presents 4 structured options for branch completion
Guides local merge with test verification after merge
Automates PR creation with properly formatted templates
Handles worktree cleanup based on chosen workflow
limitations: Requires test command to be configured in project
Does not automatically resolve merge conflicts
GitHub CLI required for PR creation feature
Assumes standard git branch structure with main/master

use_cases.title: Complete Feature Development
use_cases.description: After implementing a new feature, use this skill to merge it back to main or create a pull request with proper testing.

use_cases.title: Standardize Team Workflow
use_cases.description: Ensure team members follow consistent branch completion practices with proper test verification and cleanup.

use_cases.title: Clean Up Development Worktrees
use_cases.description: Safely clean up development worktrees after feature completion while preserving important work.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Branch Completion
prompt_templates.prompt: I have finished implementing the new checkout flow. All tests are passing. Help me complete this branch.

prompt_templates.title: After Refactoring
prompt_templates.prompt: I completed a major refactoring of the authentication system. Tests pass but I want to create a PR for code review.

prompt_templates.title: Experimental Work
prompt_templates.prompt: I built an experimental caching layer but I am not sure if we should merge it. Show me my options.

prompt_templates.title: Clean Up Branches
prompt_templates.prompt: I have several old feature branches that need to be merged or discarded. Help me clean them up systematically.

output_examples.input: I finished the payment integration. Tests are passing. What should I do next?
output: Implementation complete. What would you like to do?
2. Push and create a Pull Request

output_examples.input: I want to create a PR for my bugfix branch
output: Implementation complete. What would you like to do?
2. Push and create a Pull Request

best_practices: Always verify tests pass before offering completion options to prevent broken code integration
Present exactly 4 structured options without additional explanation to avoid ambiguity
Require typed discard confirmation before permanently deleting any work
anti_patterns: Never proceed with failing tests as this risks merging broken code
Do not ask open-ended questions like What should I do instead provide structured choices
Avoid automatic worktree cleanup when creating PRs as you may need to push updates

faq.question: Which git workflows does this support?
faq.answer: Supports standard git workflows with main or master base branches. Works with GitHub CLI for PR creation.

faq.question: What happens to my worktree after completion?
faq.answer: Worktree is cleaned up for local merges and discards but preserved when creating PRs or keeping branches.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with CI/CD?
faq.answer: The skill verifies tests pass before proceeding integrating with your existing test suite regardless of CI/CD setup.

faq.question: Is my code safe during this process?
faq.answer: Yes the skill requires confirmation before discarding work and always verifies tests before any merge operation.

faq.question: What if I encounter merge conflicts?
faq.answer: The skill stops before merging if conflicts exist. Resolve conflicts manually then run the skill again.

faq.question: How does this compare to git-flow?
faq.answer: This skill complements git-flow by providing structured completion for any branch not just feature branches.
